Crafting.Description: Crafting allows creation of items in the wasteland with necessary materials, junk, and knowledge. Requires a suitable space and tools (e.g., workbench), which may be found, created, or jury-rigged at GM’s discretion.

HowToCraft.Requirements: Crafting skill bonus must meet or exceed the item’s requirement in the Vault-Tec Item Blueprint Table. If not, attempt a Crafting skill check against DC 10 + item’s Crafting DC.

Outcomes.Effect: Fail to craft, lose 1d4 of each material (minimum 1).
Fail to craft, lose 1d6 of each material.
Craft item, consume all required materials.
Craft item, use 1d4 less of one material (minimum 1).

HowToCraft.OptionalCheck: Can attempt a Crafting skill check even if skill meets requirement to reduce material use, risking failure.
HowToCraft.Assistance: Each assistant halves crafting time (e.g., 1 hour becomes 30 minutes with one assistant, 15 minutes with two). Assistants whose Crafting skill doesn’t meet requirement must succeed on a crafting check. If any assistant fails, the item fails to craft.

DecayAndRepair.Description: Equipment degrades and requires maintenance in the wasteland.

Decay.Mechanics: Items accumulate up to 9 levels of decay via item-specific conditions, targeted attack damage, or GM discretion. At 10 levels, item breaks and ceases function.
Decay.BrokenItems: Cannot be used, operated, or provide benefits from mods, upgrades, abilities, or perks. Retains load, can be used as an improvised weapon.

ArmorDecay.Mechanics: Armor gains 1 level of decay on critical hit or when wearer falls to 0 hit points. Each level reduces AC and DT by half the decay level (rounded down). AC cannot fall below 10, DT cannot fall below 0.

WeaponDecay.Mechanics: Weapons gain 1 level of decay on critical failure of an attack roll. Each level reduces attack rolls by 1.

RepairingItems.SingleLevel: Repair one level of decay with a crafting check (DC 10 + item’s repair bonus). If Crafting skill bonus equals listed bonus, succeed automatically. Failure: no decay reduced, spend half time and materials (rounded down).
RepairingItems.BrokenItem: Repair requires 5× time and resources at once, repair bonus/DC increases by 5. Repaired item is no longer broken, has 5 levels of decay.
RepairingItems.UsingAnotherItem: Use a copy of the item or similar item (with ≤5 decay levels) to repair an additional level of decay.

Materials: x5 of each material needed for armor
